sentences.en: A lot of TV advertising is aimed at susceptible young children.
sentences.cn: 很多电视广告瞄准了易受影响的幼儿。

sentences.en: A signed agreement is not susceptible of change.
sentences.cn: 已签署的协议不可再改动.

sentences.en: Children are more susceptible than adults.
Children are susceptible to various illnesses.
Diesel exhaust is particularly aggravating to many susceptible individuals.
sentences.cn: 许多体质敏感的人尤其反感柴油废气。

sentences.en: He is ambitious and susceptible to flattery.
sentences.cn: 他雄心勃勃，而且很喜欢听别人的恭维话。

sentences.en: He's so susceptible that she easily gained his affection.
sentences.cn: 他易受感情影响,所以她很轻易地就得到了他的爱.

sentences.en: His statement is susceptible of another interpretation.
sentences.cn: 他的陈述可以有另一种解释.

sentences.en: In his weakened condition, he is very susceptible to cold.
sentences.cn: 他身体很弱, 因此很容易患感冒.

sentences.en: Older people are more susceptible to infections.
Others are more susceptible to attempts at quantification.
sentences.cn: 其他人更容易倾向于加以量化的做法。

sentences.en: The thicker the material, the less susceptible the garment will be to wet conditions.
sentences.cn: 布料越厚实，衣服就越不容易浸湿。

sentences.en: Walking with weights makes the shoulders very susceptible to injury.
sentences.cn: 负重行走时肩膀很容易受伤。

sentences.en: We are all susceptible to advertising.
sentences.cn: 我们都易受广告的影响.

sentences.en: Young people are the most susceptible to advertisements.
sentences.cn: 年轻人最容易受广告的影响。

phrases.tran_cn: 易受感染菌株；感性品系

trans.tran_cn: 易受影响的，易受感染的，善感的，可以接受或允许的
trans.tran_en: likely to suffer from a particular illness or be affected by a particular problem
